meanings.definition: An official license or approval to print or publish a book.
meanings.sent1: The author proudly displayed the imprimaturs from the publishing house.
meanings.sent2: The imprimaturs on the title page indicated the book had been approved for publication.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to forge imprimaturs to get his own story in the school newspaper.
meanings.sent4: Her imprimaturs of success were evident in the numerous bestselling books she had published.
meanings.sent5: The imprimaturs granted by the editor were like stamps of quality on the manuscript.

meanings.definition: A mark of approval or endorsement.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's red pen served as the imprimaturs on the students' essays.
meanings.sent2: The imprimaturs of the celebrity chef were seen on the new kitchen gadgets.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's wagging tail was the ultimate imprimaturs of happiness.
meanings.sent4: The imprimaturs of the famous artist were evident in the gallery's collection.
meanings.sent5: The imprimaturs of the fashion designer were sought after by many aspiring models.
